concepts.concept_name: External body parts and their functions
Sense organs (eyes, ears, nose, tongue, skin)
Taking care of our body (hygiene, exercise, rest)

in_scope: Names and functions of external body parts (hands, legs, head, etc.)
Basic internal organs and their main jobs
Five sense organs and what they help us do
Daily hygiene habits: brushing, bathing, handwashing
Importance of exercise, sleep, and healthy habits
out_of_scope: Detailed organ systems (digestive, respiratory) - Introduced in Class 4
Skeletal and muscular systems in detail - Introduced in Class 5
Diseases and their causes - Introduced in Class 3

concepts.concept_name: Differences between living and non-living things
Classification of objects as living or non-living

in_scope: Living things: need food, water, air; grow; move; reproduce
Non-living things: do not eat, grow, breathe, or have babies
Examples from daily life (plants, animals, toys, stones)
Classifying everyday objects
out_of_scope: Cells and cellular structure - Introduced in Class 6
Microorganisms - Introduced in Class 4
Life cycles in detail - Introduced in Class 3

concepts.concept_name: Parts of a plant (root, stem, leaf, flower, fruit, seed)
Types of plants (trees, shrubs, herbs, climbers, creepers)
Plants need water, air, sunlight, and soil to grow

in_scope: Six main parts of a plant and their basic functions
Root absorbs water, stem supports, leaves make food, flower becomes fruit
Difference between trees, shrubs, herbs, climbers, creepers
What plants need to grow healthy
Examples of each type of plant
out_of_scope: Photosynthesis in detail - Introduced in Class 4
Plant reproduction - Introduced in Class 5
Internal structure of plant parts - Introduced in Class 6

concepts.concept_name: Animal body coverings (fur, feathers, scales, shell)

in_scope: Where animals live: land, water, or both
What animals eat: plants, meat, or both
Names of baby animals (calf, puppy, kitten, chick, etc.)
Different body coverings and their purpose
Pet animals and wild animals
out_of_scope: Animal classification (vertebrates, invertebrates) - Introduced in Class 4
Detailed animal life cycles - Introduced in Class 3
Animal adaptations in depth - Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Types of food (fruits, vegetables, grains, dairy, meat)
Food and cooking (raw and cooked food)

in_scope: Food from plants: fruits, vegetables, grains, pulses
Food from animals: milk, eggs, meat, honey
Eating different types of food to stay healthy
Foods we eat raw vs foods we cook
Importance of eating vegetables and fruits
out_of_scope: Nutrients (proteins, carbohydrates, vitamins) - Introduced in Class 4
Digestion - Introduced in Class 4
Food preservation - Introduced in Class 5

in_scope: Uses: drinking, cooking, bathing, cleaning, watering plants
Sources: rain, rivers, lakes, wells, taps
Simple water cycle: sun heats water, clouds form, rain falls
Ways to save water at home and school
Clean water and dirty water
out_of_scope: States of water in detail - Introduced in Class 3
Water purification methods - Introduced in Class 4
Water pollution - Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Uses of air and importance of air
Types of weather (sunny, rainy, cloudy, windy)

in_scope: Air is all around us even if we cannot see it
Living things need air to breathe
Air helps in flying kites, drying clothes, sailing boats
Different types of weather and what we do in each
Clothes we wear in different weather/seasons
Three main seasons: summer, winter, rainy
out_of_scope: Composition of air - Introduced in Class 4
Air pressure - Introduced in Class 5
Climate zones - Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Day and night, Sun and Moon

in_scope: Earth has both land and water
Different types of land: mountains, hills, plains, valleys, deserts
Different water bodies and their features
The Sun gives us light and heat during the day
The Moon shines at night
Day and night cycle
out_of_scope: Earth's rotation and revolution - Introduced in Class 4
Globe and maps in detail - Introduced in Class 3
Solar system - Introduced in Class 4

in_scope: Look both ways before crossing the road
Walk on footpaths, use zebra crossings
Traffic lights: red, yellow, green meanings
Do not touch fire, sharp objects, electrical sockets
Do not run on stairs or wet floors
Do not talk to strangers or take things from them
What to do in an emergency (call for help)
out_of_scope: First aid in detail - Introduced in Class 4
Fire safety procedures - Introduced in Class 4
Natural disaster safety - Introduced in Class 5

in_scope: Why we should keep our home, school, and neighborhood clean
Throw garbage in dustbins
Wet waste and dry waste (simple introduction)
Do not harm plants and animals
Plant trees and water plants
Use things wisely, reuse old things
out_of_scope: Pollution types in detail - Introduced in Class 4
Recycling processes - Introduced in Class 5
Environmental conservation - Introduced in Class 5
